An angularity_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with angularity tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively angularity tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The specified angle shall not be a multiple of 90 degrees. In the case of 0 or 180 degrees, a
shall be used. In the case of 90 or 270 degrees, a
shall be used. The specified angle shall be defined using an instance of . The
is either a plane or a straight line.
The angularity_tolerance shall contain at least one element and at most two elements in its .
The datums referenced shall be sufficient to identify a plane or a straight line.

The datums referred to in
shall be sufficient to enable orientation of the tolerance zone.

A circular_runout_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with circular run-out tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively circular run-out tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The circular_runout_tolerance shall contain one or two elements in its .

A coaxiality_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with coaxiality tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively coaxiality tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The coaxiality_tolerance shall contain one or two elements in its .
The , the coaxiality_tolerance is applied to, is a revolute surface feature.

A concentricity_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with concentricity tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively concentricity tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The concentricity_tolerance shall contain exactly one element in its .
The , the concentricity_tolerance is applied to, is symmetrical with respect to rotation.

A cylindricity_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with cylindricity tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively cylindricity tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The cylindricity_tolerance shall not be of type .
The , the cylindricity_tolerance is applied to, is a cylindrical face.

A flatness_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with flatness tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively flatness tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The flatness_tolerance shall not be of type .
The , the flatness_tolerance is applied to, shall be a nominally planar surface.

A line_profile_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with profile tolerance of a line in ISO 1101.
Alternatively profile tolerance of a line can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The line_profile_tolerance shall contain at most three elements in its .

A parallelism_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with parallelism tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively parallelism tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The parallelism_tolerance shall contain at least one element and at most two elements in its .
The , the parallelism_tolerance is applied to, is an axis or a planar surface.
The datums referenced shall be sufficient to define a plane or a straight line.

A perpendicularity_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with perpendicularity tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively perpendicularity tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The perpendicularity_tolerance shall contain at least one element and at most three elements in its .

The
shall be either a plane or a straight line.
The datums referenced shall be suffcient to define a plane or a straight line.

A position_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with position tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively position tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
When the
is a , e.g. eight holes, the tolerance zone may but need not be defined by referenced datums (see ISO 1101).
The location of the tolerance zone shall be specified with instances of .
The type
is defined in ISO 10303-47.
See ISO 1101 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The position_tolerance shall contain at most three elements in its .

A roundness_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with roundness tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively roundness tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The
shall be of invariance class surface revolute feature but not a helical shape.
In the case of a sphere, any axis through the center point of the sphere may be considered.
The actual surface shall lie in a tolerance zone limited by two co-planar and concentric circles with a difference in radii of the tolerance value.
See ISO 1101 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The roundness_tolerance shall not be of type .

A straightness_tolerance is a type of
that applies either to the intersection curves between the surface and the planes parallel to the reference plane, or to an axis. Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with straightness tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively straightness tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The
is a surface or a straight line. Refer to the definition of straightness tolerance in ISO 1101 for a description of the different tolerance zones. In the case of intersection curves, the ideal features corresponding to the intersection curves shall be linear and there shall be another , which is related to the
by a . The
of the
shall be 'affected plane association'.
The straightness_tolerance shall not be of type .

A surface_profile_tolerance is a type of
that applies to a surface. Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with profile tolerance of a surface in ISO 1101.
Alternatively profile tolerance of a surface can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The surface_profile_tolerance shall contain at most three elements in its .

The
shall refer to a surface that is neither planar nor cylindrical. In the case where the nominal feature is planar a shall be used. In the case where the nominal feature is cylindrical a shall be used.

A symmetry_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with symmetry tolerancein ISO 1101.
Alternatively symmetry tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The symmetry_tolerance shall contain at most three elements in its .

A total_runout_tolerance is a type of . Unless otherwise specified the tolerance shall be used in accordance with total run-out tolerance in ISO 1101.
Alternatively total run-out tolerance can be used according to the specifications given in ASM 14-5-2009.
The set of referenced datums shall contain one revolute surface feature. The tolerance zone is limited either by:
two coaxial cylinders, with a difference in radii equal to the tolerance value. In this case, the axis of the cylinders shall be the axis of the revolute surface feature, and the ideal feature corresponding to the toleranced surface is a cylinder;
two parallel planes, separated by the distance specified by the tolerance value. In this case, the planes are perpendicular to the axis of the revolute surface feature, and the ideal feature corresponding to the toleranced surface is a plane.
See ISO 1101 for definition and areas of application of this type of tolerance.
The total_runout_tolerance shall contain one or two elements in its .
